Remote | Entry-level

OVERVIEW

Fractured Atlas, the largest association of artists in the U.S., is looking for a full-time Accounting Associate to provide support to the Finance team by managing daily accounting tasks and serve as a point of contact for financial transaction communication across teams.

The successful candidate will be someone who thrives in Fractured Atlass work hard, live well environment. Our organizational culture embraces people who:

  • Seek out challenging problems and relish opportunities to venture into unexplored territory.
  • Are entrepreneurial and comfortable with highrisk, highimpact efforts.
  • Are agile, creative problem solvers with an unsentimental focus on concrete results.
  • Invest their time in quality work and giving others their respect and support.

Additionally, at Fractured Atlas, we are committed to anti-racism, anti-oppression principles in all areas of our internal and external work. This commitment is grounded in our belief that change is possible, and that our work, and that of the artistic community more broadly, will grow stronger as oppression is eliminated. Learn more about what it’s like to work at Fractured Atlas by visiting work.fracturedatlas.org.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Post journal entries including bills, invoices, and payroll transactions;
  • Assist with account analysis and bank reconciliations;
  • Prepare and examine accounting records, financial statements, grant financials, and other financial reports;
  • Assist in month-end close and annual audit preparation and vouching activities;
  • Manage accounts payable and accounts receivable processing;
  • Coordinate and execute the filing of regulatory tax forms including (1099, 1042 and state charity renewal forms);
  • Communicate financial activities across departments in a timely, error-free manner.

IN THIS POSITION YOU WILL:

  • Report to the Controller, work closely with the Senior Director, Financial Operations & Analysis, and collaborate cross-functionally with other departments, including the Programs, External Relations, and Engineering teams;
  • Contribute to the achievement of company and department goals through the timely processing of financial data and coordination with various teams;
  • Ensure compliance with all accounting policies and procedures.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Ability to enter data into various electronic systems while maintaining its integrity and accuracy;
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Microsoft Excel;
  • Strong organizational skills with the ability to quickly prioritize and pivot between tasks;
  • Self-motivated and self-directed. Must have superior attention to detail and be proactive in accomplishing set goals and objectives;
  • Possesses a team mentality! The Finance team (if we say so ourselves) is energetic, innovative, and straight-up fun. We work well together and are passionate about what we do.
  • Are versed in generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) and monitor updates with FASB recommendations and standards;
  • Bonus points if you are:
    • Proficient in Quickbooks or similar Accounting software;
    • Familiar with non-profit accounting standards;
    • Experienced with data analytics platforms;
    • Passionate about independent artists, creative makers and doers!

LOCATION

This position can be 100% virtual (with travel about 2-3 times per year). The Fractured Atlas staff currently live and work in 11 different states, with the organization transitioning to be entirely virtual by January 1, 2020. As such, you can live and work almost anywhere in the United States with a reliable high-speed internet connection. Although you can work from almost anywhere, you must be available to attend meetings during a 9AM-6PM EST window.

COMPENSATION

Salary is $48,811.20/year (overtime eligible). Benefits include dental and medical insurance, flexible spending account, 401K plan with employer-contributed match, commuter benefits, professional development allowance, ticket allowance, paid vacation and sick days, paid family leave, and a casual but hard-working, friendly and supportive work environment.

OUR COMMITMENT

Fractured Atlas is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity, equity, and inclusion. (Read more about our Anti-Racism and Anti-Oppression commitment.) We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

About Kraken

Our mission is to accelerate the adoption of cryptocurrency so that you and the rest of the world can achieve financial freedom and inclusion. Founded in 2011 and with over 4 million clients, Kraken is one of the world’s largest, most successful bitcoin exchanges and we’re growing faster than ever. Our range of successful products are playing an important role in the mainstream adoption of crypto assets. We attract people who constantly push themselves to think differently and chart exciting new paths in a rapidly growing industry. Kraken is a diverse group of dreamers and doers who see value in being radically transparent. Let’s change the way the world thinks about money! Join the revolution!

About the Role

This role is fully remote and based in the US or Canada.

The Accounting Manager Internal Controls will be an integral part of the Finance leadership team. You will work closely with your Finance and Accounting leadership cohorts as well as business partners and other internal and external stakeholders. This role reports to the Corporate Controller.

Responsibilities

  • Develop company-wide and business process risk assessments to evaluate and address any impact the results may have on the control environment.
  • Design and implement efficient and effective controls across the organization.

  • Staying current to changes in regulatory guidance, industry best practices, and areas of focus/hot topics for external audits.
  • Actively building and managing relationships with Company stakeholders, while promoting the importance of compliance initiatives throughout the organization.
  • Facilitate requests between the control owners and the external audit team.

  • CPA in good standing strongly preferred
  • 7+ years of accounting/audit experience
  • Industry experience in financial services, fintech, banking, or exchange strongly preferred
  • Experience or knowledge with cryptocurrency is strongly preferred
  • Knowledge of US GAAP and experience with SOX
  • Strong communication skills

  • Experience using an ERP systems like GreatPlains, Oracle or NetSuite a plus
  • Experience with high volume transactions is a plus

Description

As an Accountingprose Superhero Accountant, you will be responsible for keeping your clients’ financials up to date on a daily, weekly, monthly, or quarterly basis. This translates to reconciling bank/credit card accounts, entering accounts payable, entering accounts receivable, processing payroll, syncing software, and preparing month-end financial statements.

You will also be responsible for building trust and rapport with our clients through weekly emailed progress reports and impromptu video calls. In return you will gain mastery over the cloud accounting software that Accountingprose utilizes to perform work, which will help you grow your industry knowledge and advance your career in the age of automation and machine learning. Our goal is increase your relevancy and marketability, while making this a place that offers challenge, excitement, and insulation from industry changes (re: the accounting robots). If you decide to make Accountingprose your forever home (we hope you do!), your career path is yours to create.

Your day-to-day tasks will include:

  • Reconciling bank, credit card, loan, merchant accounts in Xero
  • Posting one-time and repeating journal entries in Xero
  • Entering and paying bills via Bill.com
  • Entering receipts in ReceiptBank and syncing transactions to Xero
  • Entering invoices in Xero and setting up payment reminders
  • Processing and recording payroll via Gusto
  • Calculating, preparing, and remitting single and multi-state sales tax returns
  • Updating fixed asset schedules monthly (or when a client makes a big purchase)
  • Syncing software or manually pulling reports from: Mindbody, Vagaro, Clio, ActionStep, TradeGecko, Shopify, Shopkeep, Clover, Square, Stripe, Paypal, and many other SaaS apps.
  • Preparing and explaining month-end financial statements to small business owners and investors

Work Hours- Any 8 hours plus a lunch from 7am to 7pm Mountain Time. You will set your schedule when you begin working for us.

Requirements

  • Complete understanding of full cycle accounting with 2-3 year of hands on experience. You know what is happening behind the scenes when you are posting transactions and you can explain challenging accounting concepts to a novice.
  • Intermediate software knowledge: Xero, QBO/QBD, Gusto, Hubspot, Teamwork, Slack, Box, ReceiptBank. Are some of these foreign? No worries! We provide in-depth training to build your skills.
  • Ability to multitask but more excited about deep work. You will be working with a handful of clients (15-25/mo depending on the scope of work) but should be excited to work with deep focus for long stretches of time without toggling back and forth.
  • A spreadsheet wizard, able to make sense of lots of information. Vlookups and pivot tables experience a plus.
  • Strong attention to detail and good analytical skills. Nothing slips past you!

Benefits

  • Unlimited paid vacation
  • Paid company holidays
  • Paid sick days
  • Health Insurance Reimbursement
  • Company-supplied computer, second monitor, and internet allowance
  • 3% Simple IRA Salary Match
  • Work from wherever you want- we are totally virtual (though we only hire people authorized to work in the US)
  • Awesome people to work alongside of

  • Slack
